name: Body weight box squats
details: Stand tall with your back to a knee-high bench or box 4 to 6 inches behind you. Your feet should be spread shoulder-width apart. Lower your body by pushing back your hips and bending your knees until your butt touches the box or bench

name: Push up
details: The push-up is a common calisthenics exercise beginning from the prone position. By raising and lowering the body using the arms, push-ups exercise the pectoral muscles, triceps, and anterior deltoids

name: Plank
details: The plank strengthens your spine, your rhomboids and trapezius, and your abdominal muscles, which naturally result in a strong posture as they

name: Alternating Step Ups
details: Alternating Step Ups are a fantastic leg workout exercise! Not only is this exercise low risk for injury, but they also help with toning your thighs and legs

name: Dumbbell Biceps Curls
details: Biceps curls use dumbbells, barbells, or kettlebells to work the biceps muscles of the arm and build strength and muscle.

name: Dumbbell Skull Crusher
details: The skull crusher is a good exercise to activate the medial head of the triceps
